category: Member Sports Organization Regulations/Article 11 (No Confidence in Executives)
contents: Article 11 (No confidence in executives) ① The general meeting may decide to partially or entirely dismiss executives of member sports organizations. ② When dismissing all executives pursuant to paragraph 1, dismissal may be made regardless of the elapse of the executives’ term of office, and when some executives are dismissed, one full year must elapse from the date the relevant executives were elected. However, if the relevant executive is indicted, there is no limit to the elapsed period. Revised 2021. 10. 6. ③ The dismissal bill shall be proposed with the approval of a majority of the registered delegates and resolved with the approval of more than two-thirds of the registered delegates, but the relevant executive must be given an opportunity to explain himself prior to the resolution. Revised May 29, 2019, October 6, 2021 ④ When the dismissal proposal is passed, the relevant executive officer is immediately dismissed. ⑤ Once the dismissal proposal is resolved, the general meeting must elect new executives as soon as possible to ensure that there is no disruption in the performance of the member sports organization's business.
